title: Trump, DeSantis rival events accent US Republican divide
description: Two competing conservative events feature Republican rivals Trump and DeSantis as they look towards the 2024 election.

title: Biden won’t veto push to overturn law in US capital. Here’s why
description: US president angers progressives by saying he will not veto Congress bill to block justice reform in Washington, DC.

title: ‘Slavery wages’ prompt hunger strike at ICE detention facilities
description: Participants say poor living conditions and wages of $1 a day have pushed them to launch the weeks-long protest.

title: Differences remain as talks to protect high seas enter final day
description: The High Seas Treaty has been years in the making, but disagreements remain over issues including benefit sharing.

title: Protesters in Colombia clash with oil company and take hostages
description: A civilian and officer have died in violent demonstrations calling for Emerald Energy to invest in rural communities.

title: Sri Lanka raises rates, relaxes currency band to secure IMF funds
description: The country is awaiting approval of a $2.9bn IMF bailout package as it endures its worst financial crisis since 1948.

title: Israeli minister inciting violence with remarks: UN rights chief
description: Volker Turk slams Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich's call for Palestinian village of Huwara to be 'wiped out'.

title: At least 17 killed in fire at Indonesia fuel storage depot
description: Two children are among the victims and 50 other people have been admitted to hospital, fire official says.

title: How will Israel’s deepening political crisis end?
description: Protests are being held against proposed judicial reforms, and wave of Israeli raids have killed dozens of Palestinians

title: Wagner chief urges Ukraine’s Zelenskyy to abandon Bakhmut
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, head of the Russian mercenary group, says the city in Donetsk is almost completely surrounded.

title: US services sector grows steadily; prices remain high
description: The services sector is now at the center of the fight against inflation as services prices tend to be stickier.

title: Heavy snowfall leaves some California residents trapped in homes
description: Winter storms have caused power outages and complicated travel across the state, stranding some behind heavy snowfall.

title: Sub-Saharan Africans recount Tunisia ‘hell’ amid crackdown
description: Racial tensions are spinning out of control as many sub-Saharan Africans prepare to leave the country.

title: US pharmacy chain won’t dispense abortion pills in some states
description: Access to abortion medication has emerged as a major battleground in the legal struggle over the procedure in the US.

title: Alex Murdaugh sentenced to life in prison in US murder trial
description: South Carolina judge sentences former lawyer to two consecutive life sentences for murder of wife and son.

title: Train crash wreckage scoured as anger rises across Greece
description: Government accused of rail safety failures, as several Greeks wait to hear if their relatives are among victims.

title: Pakistan’s president says Punjab polls to be held on April 30
description: Constitutional crisis expected to be resolved after vote set from dates proposed by Election Commission.

title: The Wagner Group explained | Start Here
description: What is the Wagner Group? What does it do? And how has the war in Ukraine shifted things for the group?

title: Morocco and PSG defender Achraf Hakimi charged with rape
description: Prosecutors in Paris say the player was indicted by a judge and placed under judicial supervision.

title: Unreliable US leadership in the shadow of elections
description: Biden, Trump, DeSantis and the scenarios for the 2024 presidential elections.

title: Iran president blames foreign enemies for schoolgirl poisonings
description: Raisi did not say who the enemies were, although Tehran habitually accuses the US and Israel of acting against it.

title: Kupiansk: Ukraine orders people to leave city liberated last year
description: Ukrainian authorities say mandatory evacuation begins for families with children and residents having limited mobility.

title: Who is Belarusian Nobel laureate Ales Bialiatski?
description: Bialiatski, Belarus’s top human rights advocate, was sentenced to 10 years in prison. We take a look at his trajectory.

title: Cricket: Inaugural Women’s Premier League set to start in India
description: Game-changing moment for women's sport as three-week event with the world's best players starts in Mumbai on Saturday.

title: Turkish opposition expected to announce election candidate soon
description: Leaders of six parties met to discuss their presidential candidate - widely expected to be the CHP's Kilicdaroglu.

title: Belarus sentences Nobel laureate Bialiatski to 10 years in prison
description: Bialiatski and three top figures of the human rights centre he founded convicted of financing anti-government protests.

title: S Korea, US to hold joint military drills despite N Korea warning
description: South Korea and the US will go ahead with the 'Freedom Shield' and 'Warrior Shield' joint exercises from March 13 to 23.

title: What is behind the US military’s recruitment crisis?
description: In an UpFront Special, Marc Lamont Hill examines why the US armed forces are failing to hit their recruitment targets.

title: SpaceX crew docks at International Space Station
description: The autonomously flying spacecraft, carrying four crew members, docked successfully on Friday morning.

title: Half of the world on track to be overweight or obese by 2035
description: The World Obesity Federation predicts that 51 percent of the world will be overweight, and 1 in 4 people will be obese.

title: Gunmen fire at Messi family store in Argentina, threaten player
description: Authorities say nobody was injured in the early morning attack on supermarket owned by Messi's in-laws in Rosario.

title: Israeli settler attacks against Palestinians by the numbers
description: Between 2010 and 2019, nearly 3,000 Israeli settler attacks killed at least 22 Palestinians and injured 1,258 others.

title: Israel kills 15-year-old Palestinian ‘shot in the back’
description: Palestinians say Muhammad Nidal Salim was killed after Israeli forces entered the occupied West Bank town of Azzoun.

title: Russia’s Andrey Kelin: Ukraine invasion can be called ‘civil war’
description: The Russian ambassador to the UK discusses the conflict in Ukraine, year on.

title: Battleground university: Neoliberalism is silencing education
description: Progressive thought and scholarship are under assault on campuses as the idea of the university is hollowed out.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 373
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 373rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: UN experts accuse Nicaragua government of crimes against humanity
description: Human rights experts are calling for sanctions against President Daniel Ortega's government.

title: Rohingya in Bangladesh camps decry ‘devastating’ UN food aid cuts
description: After a $125m donation shortfall, monthly food vouchers were cut from $12 to $10 per person, said World Food Programme.

title: ‘Miscarriage of justice’: Reactions to Kem Sokha conviction
description: United States, rights groups condemn sentence of 27 years' house arrest against prominent Cambodian opposition leader.

title: Russia envoy denies atrocities, blames West for Ukraine’s misery
description: Russian ambassador to UK Andrei Kelin said the killing of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha was 'staged' by Ukrainian forces.

title: Malaysia’s ex-PM Najib acquitted of tampering with 1MDB audit
description: Former leader will remain in prison where he is serving a 12-year sentence on other charges related to the 1MDB scandal.

title: Is North Korea fighting a food crisis?
description: North Korea has called for agricultural improvements as concerns grow of a worsening food crisis.

title: China’s BGI, Inspur added to US trade blacklist
description: US Department of Commerce alleges units of BGI and Inspur pose a 'significant risk' of aiding surveillance by Beijing.

title: Cambodia opposition leader Kem Sokha sentenced to 27 years
description: Former leader of now banned Cambodian National Rescue Party was arrested in 2017 and accused of treason.

title: US arrests two for allegedly exporting aviation tech to Russia
description: Prosecutors allege the Kansas men conspired to evade US export laws starting in 2020.

title: China beating West in race for critical technologies, report says
description: China leads the world in 37 out of 44 critical technologies, according to a report by an Australian think tank.

title: Firefighters battle blaze at Hong Kong high-rise building site
description: The fire started at the top of the 42-storey skyscraper, which was close to completion, and engulfed the scaffolding.

title: All you need to know about China’s ‘Two Sessions’
description: The annual meetings of China's parliament and political advisory body will include a GDP forecast for 2023.

title: Alex Murdaugh found guilty in high-profile US murder trial
description: The judge presiding over the South Carolina murder trial has said the evidence against the ex-lawyer is 'overwhelming'.

title: House Ethics panel investigates US Representative George Santos
description: Santos has consistently refused calls to step down amid scrutiny of false claims about his work and personal history.
